result.execSummary:
The defendant Damian L Donaldson Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 9/26/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damian L Donaldson Sr

records.addlTxt:
12:13 PM Defendant Damian L Donaldson Sr in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Damian L Donaldson Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for jury status hearing in 22CM439.
Parties have reached an agreement.
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
FINE: $ 267.50
	
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $ 25.00 per month commencing 9/26/22.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 6/22/22

Jury status hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 9:13 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Damian L Donaldson in court with attorney Eryn M Menden. 
Attorney Menden requests that the case be set on the trial calendar.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:48 AM Defendant Damian L Donaldson in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is waiting for an offer.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on March 17, 2022.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney Eryn M Menden

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of his employment.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:02 PM Defendant Damian L Donaldson in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
